meanings.definition: The act of moving heavily or clumsily.
meanings.sent1: The lumberings of the elephant shook the ground.
meanings.sent2: I could hear the lumberings of the giant bear in the forest.
meanings.sent3: The lumberings of the penguin trying to waddle fast were quite comical.
meanings.sent4: The lumberings of the old ship through the stormy sea were a testament to its strength.
meanings.sent5: The lumberings of the sleepy giant were a sight to behold.

meanings.definition: A series of heavy, awkward movements.
meanings.sent1: The lumberings of the robot were slow but steady.
meanings.sent2: She watched the lumberings of the tired horse as it crossed the field.
meanings.sent3: The lumberings of the clumsy clown made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The lumberings of the boulder down the hill were unstoppable.
meanings.sent5: The lumberings of the baby elephant were adorable to watch.

meanings.definition: The sound of heavy, clumsy movement.
meanings.sent1: The night was silent except for the distant lumberings of the approaching storm.
meanings.sent2: The eerie forest was filled with the mysterious lumberings of unseen creatures.
meanings.sent3: The lumberings of the clumsy waiter carrying the tray made everyone nervous.
meanings.sent4: The lumberings of the heavy machinery echoed through the empty warehouse.
meanings.sent5: The lumberings of the tired hiker's footsteps echoed in the canyon.
